answers.answer: Please ask you surgeon what is the "potential for good vision." A number of factors can contribute to blurry or poor vision early after cataract surgery: corneal edema being the most common. The vision should begin to slowly improve and a refraction is normal and also should improve the vision. Good luck.

question: My mother had a cataract removed 4 days ago (right eye), and after one day she is not seeing well the letters and the second day there is a refraction in the eyesight.  The doctor said it "should clear up in 48 hours" but it still.  What causes this?  As you can imagine, she's very disappointed, can you offer any helpful suggestions?  She is eighty-one, no diabetes or macular degeneration, or other eye problems.  Thanks for your time..
title: catarcat
